title: COMPAS-MIGOBS impact project
abstractText:
Immigration is one of the most important public policy issues in the UK. Public debates and media coverage of migration are often highly polarised and based on assertions and opinions rather than facts and evidence.

The purpose of the COMPAS-MIGOBS impact project is to make migration data and research more accessible to key users, such as Government officials, private business and non-governmental organisations, as well as the general public.The specific project goals are to:

  • promote a more evidence based migration debate by making analysis of data on migration and migrants highly accessible to a wide range of academic and non-academic users
  • strengthen migration policy making by providing rigorous, independent and strictly evidence based analysis of what we know and don't know about migration and its impacts in the UK
  • establish strategic knowledge exchange partnerships by sharing knowledge between producers of statistics (Home Office and ONS), COMPAS/ Migration Observatory and the wider academic community
  •  improve understanding of how migration is covered by the media by offering a web-based facility that analyses media discourse on migration.
